metadata.title: Wednesday, 15th October, 2014
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Kawambwa-Mulwe road in Luapula Province will be tarred.
Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health what measures the Government is taking to improve the adult literacy levels in the rural areas of Kalabo District.

parts: (a)    what measures the Government has taken to address the problem of counterfeit Kwacha notes; and
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to sensitise rural communities on counterfeit notes in order to protect them from being swindled.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth and Sport why youths in Sesheke Parliamentary Constituency did not benefit from the Youth Development Fund in 2012 and 2013.
Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    how much money was spent on the electrification of Makululu Compound in Kabwe District;
(b)    how many households have so far been electrified; and
(c)    what the economic benefits of the project are.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    what the total number of Secondary Schools under construction in Isoka District is; and
(b)    what criterion was used to name one of the Schools after President Michael Chilufya Sata.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Solwezi Airport will be rehabilitated and expanded to cater for the increased traffic.
questions.question_text: NOTICE OF MOTION AND ORDER OF THE DAY Mr Miyutu “Stiffen Law on Stock Theft:  That this House urges the Government to stiffen the law relating to stock theft in order to enhance livestock farming.” 1    Supply - Motion (10th October) – Resumption of Debate.
